basics.name: Youngeun Yoon
basics.summary: Bachelor's student in Biomedical Engineering at Kyung Hee University aspiring to pursue a Master's degree.

work.name: Radiology Lab
work.summary: Published a research paper in a leading scientific journal describing the results of the experiment. Used statistical analysis to draw meaningful conclusions from the data collected from the experiment

_comment_volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Kyung Hee University, Yongin, Republic of Korea

_comment_awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
_comment_awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

_comment_publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
_comment_publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

_comment_publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
_comment_publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

_comment_publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
_comment_publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Classification of Brain Tumor
projects.summary: Developed a deep learning-based CNN model to detect and classify brain tumors using MRI scans. Trained and evaluated the model on a dataset with four categories: Glioma, Meningioma, Pituitary Tumor, and No Tumor.

projects.name: Real-time Gait Measurement Device
projects.summary: Developed a lightweight, portable gait measurement device with pressure sensors attached to shoes. Utilized AVR and Bluetooth communication to transmit real-time foot pressure data to a PC. Implemented a Python-based software for real-time graphical visualization and color-mapped foot pressure analysis.

projects.name: Bio signal Based Stress Monitoring system
projects.summary: Measured and analyzed multiple bio-signals to detect stress and relaxation states. Developed a real-time stress detection system
